data.title: Garrett Cook - Men's Basketball
data.meta_description: Garrett Cook (33) Shooting Guard  - 2019-20 – Appeared in 27 games, making 20 starts at shooting guard … led the team in 3-pointers and 3-point attempts  (46-of-122)

Biography

2019-20 – Appeared in 27 games, making 20 starts at shooting guard … led the team in 3-pointers and 3-point attempts (46-of-122) for the second straight season … knocked down 16-of-22 shots at the line … averaged 7.3 points and 2.6 rebounds per game … dished out 31 assists … totaled a team-high 733 minutes on the season … shot 41 percent from the floor … made a trifecta in every game but five, including a season- team-high five against St. Augustine’s and Roberts Wesleyan … also scored a season-best 20 points and went 7-of-10 from the floor against St. Augustine’s … tied for second on the team with 19 steals ... Earned PSAC scholar-athlete ... Earned D2ADA Academic Achievement Award ... Earned Criminal Justice Outstanding Senior Award.

2018-19 - Started in all 28 games for the Mounties, logging 1014 minutes in his junior year which ranked third on the team and 10th in the Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference ... Led the PSAC in 3-point field goal percentage, knocking down 45% of his shots from long range … Ranked fifth in the conference and led the team in 3-point field goals made … Reached double digits in scoring 15 times … Hit the 20+ point plateau twice, including his season-high 21 point outing on 7-for-10 shooting from the field, all from beyond the arc, in the final game of the season at Bloomsburg (2/27/19) … Shot 42.7% from the field to lead the team and rank 24th in the conference … Pulled down a season-high eight rebounds against Millersville (2/2/19) … Scored at least 10 points and had five or more rebounds in four games.

Previous - Played basketball at Patriot High School in Bristow, Va. and was a member for the Fairmont State team for two years ... Became the school's All-Time Leading Scorer with 1,083 total points ... Earned First-Team All-Conference honors following both his junior and senior seasons ... Was a Two-Time Second-Team All-Region player, playing in the biggest region in the state of Virginia ... Averaged 21.4 points as a senior at Patriot High ... Made over 150 three-pointers during his junior and senior seasons ... Was a redshirt as a freshman on Fairmont State’s National Finalist team ... Father, Tim Cook '94, played basketball at Mansfield, graduating with over 1,000 career points and earning a spot in the Mansfield Athletics Hall of Fame.
